Prolog.Narrator-00: Have you ever heard about the legend of the great red dragon. About the crazy story of the one who defeated it?
Prolog.Narrator-01: Once the Land was thriving and things where going great. Good weather, good people.
Prolog.Narrator-02: Until someday some odd things started happening...
Prolog.Narrator-03: It all started with a new uprising monster which was believed to be the legendary red dragon.
Prolog.Narrator-04: We write the year 1325 aC. Scattered in the forests of the Land Utoperia more and more villages start to disappear.
Prolog.Narrator-05: Well, they don't really disappear but rather get diminished by something fast, big and destructive.
Prolog.Narrator-06: Village after village was destroyed and it only kept worse..
Prolog.Narrator-07: But the Villages in the east of Utopiria where untouched so far. So far so good..
Prolog.Narrator-08: That's the point where our hero comes into play..

theBeginning.Narrator-00: Our story begins in a distant corner of eastern Utopiria, nestled within a quiet, unassuming village...
theBeginning.Narrator-01: Birds chirped melodiously, filling the ait with their cheerful tunes as a gentle breeze whispered trough the trees..
theBeginning.Narrator-02: Lukas was just an ordinary guy living an ordinary life. Yet, a quiet unease tugged at the edges of his soul...
theBeginning.Narrator-03: He felt it deep within ... he was meant for something more. More than the quiet legacy of a blacksmith’s son.
theBeginning.Narrator-04: His days passed in the long shadow of his family’s forge, each one echoing the last in a weary, predictable rhythm.
theBeginning.Narrator-05: What haunted Lukas most was how his village remained so eerily calm... while elsewhere, the red dragon brought ruin and fear without mercy.
theBeginning.Narrator-06: One day, he came to a quiet but resolute conclusion: if no one else would stand against the dragon, his village might be next.
theBeginning.Narrator-07: And so, he began to forge a plan...
theBeginning.Narrator-08: Night fell gently over the land. Fireflies drifted like tiny stars through the warm air, frogs croaked in chorus, and the world slowly slipped into slumber.
theBeginning.Narrator-09: But soon that calm scenery was interrupted by some noise..
theBeginning.Marry-00: Lukas, how many times must must we go trough this? Your duties to the village are important!
theBeginning.Marry-01: It is not appropriate to constantly chase after your own dreams!

Lukas-00.React emotional: But Mother, I have dreams and ambitions beyond these village borders!
Lukas-00.React angry: But Mother, why the hell am I always being held back by you both?
Lukas-00.Try to negotiate: But Mother, look at what's going on. Open your eyes! What if our village is next? We could all die!

Lukas-01: I don't want to spend my whole life only doing what's expected of me!
I never got to do what I wanted. I always just followed the crowd like some mind-controlled idiot!
I don't want to lose my parents, I don't want to lose my family, I don't want to lose my friends. I just want this terror to end.
Paul-00: And what exactly are these dreams, Lukas? Do you think you're the only one who feels the need to achieve something?!
You aren't an idiot. You're my son! And you didn't just follow the crowd. You played your role in our village’s life.
I understand, and I'm scared too... but I don't know. If someone could actually face the dragon, it would've already happened.
Lukas-02: No, Father, but I don't want to be just anybody! I want to accomplish something great—something that will make people marvel!
Oh come on... seriously! I play a role anyone could easily replace... because it's nothing special. We need someone who can make the dragon stop!
I know it looks dangerous, I really understand. And I can imagine it must sound terribly crazy... but I have a plan.
Marry-02: But your grandfather was a talented blacksmith in this village. Your uncle is a skilled merchant. Why isn't that enough for you?
You have your place—like everyone else. Isn't that something? And what on earth could you possibly do to a dragon with power you can't even imagine?!
Well, a plan is something. But it needs to be solid. This dragon is the scariest, most terrifying thing Utopiria has ever known.
Lukas-03:
Because I don't want to spend my whole life in the shadows of others.
Because I want to forge my own path—create my own legends!
I am sure it's possible. I know it. And if I don't face him, who else will?
I understand your concerns, but I'm serious. There is a way. Everything has some kind of weakness—and so does the dragon.
Paul-01: Your own legends!? That's pure nonsense! You're barely grown and you think you can slay a fire dragon?!
No, it's not—at least not for you!
And what kind of weakness could this dragon possibly have? He could just snap his claws and set someone ablaze!
Paul-02: Someone already tried and failed. What makes you believe you can really do it?! You're in over your head!
Or do you mean the fire core... no, come on, don't tell me that's your idea...
Lukas-04: I will prove it! I’m going to slay the Red Fire Dragon that’s terrorizing the land!
Why wouldn't you believe me?! You're acting like I'm not brave enough. Why is that? I just want everyone to live in peace!
I know it's a myth... but maybe that's exactly what the dragon uses as the source of his power.
Lukas-05: And then you’ll see that I am more than just the blacksmith’s son!
Am I right? You never did. You never really believed in me! That’s so pathetic!
It all makes sense. Why would a dragon be able to wipe out an entire village in one go? That can’t be normal fire!
Marry-03: Lukas, stop! You’re not a knight nor a legend! You’re our son, and we only want what’s best for you.
That’s rude! You’re not supposed to speak to your father in that tone!
I’ve heard about that legend too, but I don’t know... Your argument makes sense. A normal dragon wouldn’t be capable of this.
Lukas-06: You don’t understand me! I have to go and prove that I am more!
I am not! A real loving father wouldn’t do all this!
I’m sure it’s possible! I just need to get to that fire core and destroy it... or the dragon.
Lukas-07: ...Maybe then you'll be proud of me... maybe not. But at least I will have saved our village—and maybe even all of Utopiria.
It’s not going to be easy, and it will be a rough road—but I must try. Please, have I ever disappointed you?
Paul-03: Lukas, wait! Come to your senses, my son!
Okay, that's enough. You'll be under house arrest until you come to your senses again!
Well... when do you want to leave? I really hope you’re prepared and understand the power you're facing. You’ve convinced me. But be careful. Don’t get yourself killed!
Lukas-08:
There is nothing more to say, Father. My destiny is not here.
I will defeat the dragon and free the land from that beast!
Oh come on! That’s so unfair!!!
I promise you, I'll come back! No—I *am* coming back, no matter what!
Narrator-10: And so Lukas ran away from his family, his village, and left behind all that was familiar to him.
And so Lukas was locked away until—well, I don’t know how long... What was my line again?
And so Lukas left his family, his village, and all that was known to him—hoping to someday return with the good news that the dragon had finally fallen.
Narrator-11: He packed his mighty sword, forged in secret by his own hands.
Ah, shit! I lost that last part... Anyway, Lukas never even began his adventure—ah, that storyline’s broken, sorry.
He packed his mighty sword and a few essential supplies...

Forest-Narrator.Narrator-00: And so, Lukas began his great adventure. He had left everything behind. There was no turning back now. It was up to him to defeat the dragon.
Forest-Narrator.Narrator-01: Driven by a burning desire to put an end to suffering and misery, he set out on his journey.
Forest-Narrator.Narrator-02: Lukas wandered through the most diverse landscapes...
Forest-Narrator.Narrator-03: He fought his way through dense, shadow-shrouded forests.
Forest-Narrator.Narrator-06: Yet deep within, he knew how perilous the mission he had embarked upon truly was.
Forest-Narrator.Narrator-07: His heart pounded between courage and fear, between hope and doubt.
Forest-Narrator.Narrator-08: No one before him had ever dared to stand against the dragon.
Forest-Narrator.Narrator-09: Had the others failed because they lacked courage? Or was he simply overestimating his own strength?
Forest-Narrator.Narrator-10: And why had the dragon unleashed his wrath upon this land in the first place?
Forest-Narrator.Narrator-11: Questions upon questions... Yet Lukas did not waver. No – deep in his heart, he knew: he would succeed. He had to succeed!
Forest-Narrator.Narrator-12: But soon, he came upon an obstacle...

TheGreatDragonFight.Narrator-00: After dozens of days, after countless obstacles overcome, after so much hoping and fighting, our hero finally reaches the Valley of Darkness.
TheGreatDragonFight.Narrator-01: Only a few miles now separate him from the Fire Dragon. Brave and resolute, determined to finish what he once began, Lukas sets out toward the heart of this dark domain.
TheGreatDragonFight.Narrator-02: Guided by the ever-burning hope to defeat the dragon once and for all and bring peace to the land, he presses on.
TheGreatDragonFight.Narrator-03: The air is heavy and thick with sulfur. A distant rumble echoes through the valley, like the breath of an ancient beast barely able to contain its rage.
TheGreatDragonFight.Narrator-04: Then—thunder. The ground trembles. Between smoke and flame, the dragon rises. Its scales glow like molten iron, its eyes blazing with ancient hatred.
TheGreatDragonFight.Narrator-05: For a moment, Lukas stands still. Fear and determination clash within him, but then he tightens his grip on his sword. The moment of truth has come...
